question.questionA: Fertile stamens two.
question.questionB: Stamens four or five.

question.questionA: Flowers in a terminal spike or cluster.
question.questionB: Flowers solitary or in axillary spikes.

question.questionA: Leaves ovate, crenate, upper sessile, lower shortly petiolate; corolla 2-3 mm, deep blue, equalling calyx; capsule more or less glabrous.
question.questionB: Lower leaves lanceolate or ovate, shortly petiolate; upper leaves sessile, pinnatifid; corolla 3 mm, deep blue, much shorter than calyx; capsule glandular hairy.

question.questionA: Flowers solitary, axillary.
question.questionB: Flowers numerous, in axillary spikes or clusters.

question.questionA: Flowers white, 3-4 mm across; calyx lobes rounded.
question.questionB: Flowers blue, more than 5 mm across; calyx lobes acute.

question.questionA: Leaves with  five  to  seven  large  teeth or  small  lobes near  the base; sepals cordate.
question.questionB: Leaves regularly crenate-serrate; sepals cuneate.

question.questionA: Flowers 8-12 mm across; corolla darker blue towards the base, lower lobe paler than the rest; calyx lobes divergent in fruit.
question.questionB: Flowers  4-8  mm  across;  corolla  uniformly  blue;  calyx  lobes  not divergent in fruit.

question.questionA: Annuals; calyx lobes adpressed to capsule.
question.questionB: Perennials; calyx lobes not adpressed to capsule.

question.questionA: Bracts  linear  not  exceeding  pedicels; corolla pale blue; pedicels ascending after flowering.
question.questionB: Bracts lanceolate usually exceeding pedicels; corolla pinkish; pedicels spreading after flowering.

question.questionA: Stamens four or five, some or all filaments densely hairy.
question.questionB: Stamens four, filaments not hairy.

question.questionA: Flowers solitary in the axil of each bract; upper petals with red blotches at the base; stamens four, unequal, filaments with violet hairs.
question.questionB: At least the lower bracts with clusters of several flowers; upper petals not distinguished by red blotches; stamens five.

question.questionA: Filaments of upper stamens with white hairs, filaments of lower stamens glabrous.
question.questionB: Filaments of all stamens with violet hairs.

question.questionA: Basal  leaves ovate; inflorescence usually unbranched; calyx 6-9 mm, lobes oblong.
question.questionB: Basal leaves pinnatifid; inflorescence usually branched; calyx 2-4 mm, lobes acute.

question.questionA: Corolla neither spurred nor saccate.
question.questionB: Corolla either spurred or saccate.

question.questionA: Calyx four lobed; corolla two-lipped.
question.questionB: Calyx five lobed.

question.questionA: Calyx inflated, campanulate, deeply divided into two dentate lobes.
question.questionB: Calyx not inflated, cylindrical, with four acute lobes.

question.questionA: Non-viscid annuals; flowers c. 10 mm long, reddish purple with a white tube, rarely white or yellow.
question.questionB: Viscid annuals; flowers 15-20 mm long, bright yellow.

question.questionA: Leaves alternate or in a basal rosette.
question.questionB: Leaves opposite.

question.questionA: Plants up to 50 cm or more; flowers drooping, tubular; corolla lobes erect, unequal.
question.questionB: Plants up to 15 cm; flowers erect; corolla lobes spreading, equal.

question.questionA: Leaves spathulate; flowers strongly zygomorphic, pale pink.
question.questionB: Leaves reniform; flowers almost actinomorphic, bright yellow

question.questionA: Annuals;  leaves  ovate,  irregularly  serrate;  flowers  in  long-stalked axillary clusters.
question.questionB: Perennials;  leaves divided or regularly serrate; in terminal leafless pyramidal clusters.

question.questionA: Shrubby,  woody-based  perennials,  up  to  30 cm; leaves dentate, pinnate or bipinnate;  flowers up  to 4 mm,  crimson or crimson and white.
question.questionB: Herbaceous perennials, more than 40 cm.

question.questionA: Stems winged; leaves ovate, regularly serrate; corolla red.
question.questionB: Stems not winged; leaves deeply divided; corolla red with broad white margins, rarely white.

question.questionA: Corolla saccate.
question.questionB: Corolla spurred.

question.questionA: Calyx much shorter than corolla.
question.questionB: Calyx at least as long as corolla.

question.questionA: Leaves at least twice as long as broad, usually linear or oblong, sessile or on short petioles.
question.questionB: Leaves  less  than  twice  as  long  as broad,  rounded at the base or cordate, petiolate.

question.questionA: Flowers axillary; bracts similar to the leaves; capsule opening by pores.
question.questionB: Flowers  in  terminal   clusters;  bracts much  shorter  than the leaves; capsule opening by valves.

question.questionA: Corolla blue, lower lip blue; capsule ovoid, horizontally ridged.
question.questionB: Corolla blue, lower lip yellow and white; capsule globular, smooth.

question.questionA: Perennials; leaves glaucous; corolla orange-red; calyx with reddish stalked glands.
question.questionB: Annuals or perennials; flowers purple, lilac or white.

question.questionA: Flowers predominantly lilac or purple.
question.questionB: Flowers predominantly white or variegated.

question.questionA: Perennials; leaves linear-lanceolate, green or glaucous; upper leaves alternate, lower leaves in whorls; spur less than half the length of the corolla; corolla pale lilac or white striped with lilac.
question.questionB: Annuals; upper leaves linear, alternate; lower leaves elliptic, in whorls of three; spur more than half the length of the corolla; corolla violet, throat boss white.

question.questionA: Erect  unbranched annuals; leaves linear, green, mostly alternate; flowers pure white, spur curved, twice as long as corolla.
question.questionB: Erect annuals; leaves ovate, glaucous, slightly fleshy, mostly in whorls of three; flowers yellowish white, throat-boss orange, spur violet, curved and pointed.

question.questionA: Leaves palmately lobed.
question.questionB: Leaves sagittate or ovate-cordate.

question.questionA: Leaves with five to nine lobes, glabrous at maturity; throat-boss usually yellow.
question.questionB: Leaves with three to five lobes, hairy at maturity; throat-boss white or lilac.

question.questionA: Leaves sagittate.
question.questionB: Leaves ovate-cordate.

question.questionA: Erect annuals, up to 90 cm; leaves linear-sagittate; corolla violet.
question.questionB: Procumbent  perennials, up to 70 cm long; leaves ovate-sagittate; corolla pale lilac; lip white, purple-spotted.

question.questionA: Flowers very pale lilac, upper lips purple.
question.questionB: Flowers bright yellow, upper lips dark brownish-purple.
